alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Harrison; Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL HARRISON... SOUTHEASTERN GUERNSEY...NORTHWESTERN MONROE...WESTERN BELMONT AND NORTHEASTERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Caldwell, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Barnesville, Bethesda, Flushing, Quaker City, Senecaville, Belmont, Holloway, Morristown, Summerfield, Sarahsville, Salesville, and Somerton. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 190 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
